* She flinched and pulled herself away as Prowl stroked her back, feeling 
disgusted by his touch, but only because she was disgusted with herself.
She couldn't transform and she looked like a nightmare, something that she 
would never have expected in her entire online life!

Turning her head Iron Raptor found herself looking sidelong at her hazy 
refelction in the polished hallway wall, her unfamilier arms pulling in at 
her sides.
Her voice a whisper.*

" But I am a monster...because I don't know what else I could possably be."

* She clenched her fists, bowed her head and closed her eyes, horrigied and 
disgusted by her reflection alone.
But she shock her head at Prowls words.*

" No...nono, this goes deeper then damages. I can FEEL it, living, like 
crawling like a slimy mass in the back of my mind!! Maybe...Iris will know. 
She was part of my programming for years, she HAS to know something about 
this!"

* And with that she whipped around, and started down the hall at a dead run, 
going down to all fors in mid-stride to increase her speed.
Iron Raptor disappeared down the hall before she could give Prowl the chance 
to chase after her. But she called back, her rough voice echoing over the 
walls.*

" Stay here, that's an order!"

* There was no sign of Striker and she somehow knew that he wasn't going to 
be seen around the Maximals anymore, so the only bot Prowl had left to take 
orders from was either Kluster or herself. And even though she was unable to 
transform, that didn't mean that she was removed of her command.

She ran down the halls as fast as she could, her claws pounding away at the 
armored floor as she headed for the back exit, her intended 
destination...the Ark.*

__________________________IRIS

* There was something wrong besides the fact that the Ark was almost 
completely gone, something...black. Like a gathering of stormy clouds on the 
edge of a blue sky.
However...this was something seriouse. But she knew what it was without even 
having to guess.
They had merged, her beast modes...and they were refusing to let the logic 
take complete control...not allowing her to TF into robot mode.
And she was on her way to the Ark, for the answer to the question Iris knew 
she would ask.
And the strange thing was, Iris knew that this would happen, it was only a 
matter of time.*
